definition: ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve

sentences.english: Anyway, I hadn't yet done what I'd come back to do.
sentences.chinese: 况且，我也还没干完我从鬼门关回来该做的事。

sentences.english: The firemen rescued the little girl form the jaws of death.
sentences.chinese: 这起事故的受害者是被人从鬼门关里抢救出来。

sentences.english: A family dog rescued a newborn boy from the jaws of death.
sentences.chinese: 一只家养犬把一个新生男婴从鬼门关救了回来。

sentences.english: International breaks are a nervous time for managers.
sentences.chinese: 国际比赛日对于经理们来说是个鬼门关。

sentences.english: If you work too many hours your job can become the jaws of death.
sentences.chinese: 假如你工作太多小时，你的工作将把你带入鬼门关。

sentences.english: Through the gate of hell from outer space, life urn colleagues preserved fish head boat.
sentences.chinese: 自过鬼门关外天，命同人鲊瓮头船。

sentences.english: His drug addiction was so bad that it became his jaws of death.
sentences.chinese: 他的赌瘾太深了，让他到了鬼门关。

definition: nine deaths and still alive (idiom); a narrow escape/new lease of life
mortal danger, escape alive (idiom); a narrow escape/to survive by the skin of one's teeth
one is bound for good fortune after surviving a great disaster (proverb)
pinyin: da4 nan4 bu4 si3 , bi4 you3 hou4 fu2

definition: to return from the grave/(old) to recycle (waste products)
dead end/(fig.) the road to disaster
lit. nest of devils/place occupied by sinister forces
lit. reincarnated in sb else's body (idiom); fig. a discarded or discredited idea returns in another guise
